profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-02-06 13:34:04 -0500.

physdesc.extent: 17 of the 24 digital objects comprise 3,838 files.

did.abstract: University Information Technology (UIT) is a university-wide service dedicated to the strategic planning, implementation and support of technical products and services for the Tufts community. This collection contains records of UIT and the Office of the Chief Information Officer, including reports, brochures, posters, presentations, communications, meeting minutes, photos and videos.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: University records are closed for 20 years from the date of their creation. Records older than 20 years that do not pertain to student education, staff and faculty employment and Board of Trusteees records are open for research. This collection may require review before it is available for use. Please contact DCA or further details.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred by the University Information Technology Office, 2008 -- 2021.

appraisal.head: Appraisal
appraisal.p: Go-Pro videos of a Tufts Technology Services bowling outing that were part of accession UA-2020-052 were not retained due to their large file size and lack of research value. Records and Accessioning Archivist, Jane Kelly, contacted the Office of the Chief Information Officer to inform them of this decision and ensure they had access to the original files if necessary.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged in received order in three series: Additional accessions, the Office of the Chief Information Officer records, and Library Technology Services records.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: University Information Technology (UIT) is a university-wide service dedicated to the strategic planning, implementation and support of technical products and services that anticipate and meet the academic and business needs of the Tufts community. Under the direction of the Vice President and Chief Information Officer, UIT delivers information technologies to the university that faciliate teaching, learning, research, administration and outreach.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: University Information Technology Records, 1984 -- 2019. Tufts University. Digital Collections and Archives. Medford, MA.

processinfo.head: Processing status
processinfo.p: This collection is minimally processed. In June 2020, Margaret Peachy, Digital Archivist, and Jane Kelly, Records and Accessioning Archivist processed accession UA-2020-052, the records of Chief Information Officer David Kahle. Accessions UA-2022-010 and UA-2022-021 were processed by Records and Accessioning Archivist, Jane Kelly, in October 2021, and accession UA-2022-012 was processed by Records and Accessioning Archivist, Jane Kelly, in December 2021. Original order was maintained and loose items were placed in archival folders.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: University Information Technology (UIT) is a university-wide service dedicated to the strategic planning, implementation and support of technical products and services that anticipate and meet the academic and business needs of the Tufts community. This collection contains the records of UIT and the Office of the Chief Information Officer including reports, brochures, posters, presentations, communications, meeting minutes, photos, and videos.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material in this collection may be protected by copyright and other rights. Please see "Reproductions and Use" on the Digital Collections and Archives website for more information about reproductions and permission to publish. Copyright to all materials created by Tufts University employees in the course of their work is held by the Trustees of Tufts University.

did.unittitle: Strategic plans, budget proposal, and reports
Office of the Chief Information Officer records

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred by the Office of the Chief Information Officer, 2020 -- 2021, accessions UA-2020-052 and UA-2022-012.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The material from accession UA-2020-052 in this series was processed by Margaret Peachy, Digital Archivist, and Jane Kelly, Records and Accessioning Archivist, in July 2020. The Digital Archivist accessioned all the material in the BitCurator environment with the exception of Go-Pro videos of a Tufts Technology Services bowling outing, which were appraised as non-permanent records. Each top-level folder served as the basis for a zip file, with the exception of "Administrative files and video footage of David Kahle," which contains smaller directories and loose files. The Records and Accessioning Archivist created metadata for each zip file. Material from the UA-2022-012 accession was processed by Records and Accessioning Archivist, Jane Kelly, in December 2021. Received order was maintained. Loose material was placed in archival folders.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records from the Office of the Chief Information Officer. These records include presentations, reports, communications, meeting minutes, photos, and videos. The material dates from 1998 to 2019, which includes David J. Kahle's tenure as Tufts' Vice President for Information Technology and Chief Information Officer from 2009 to 2018. These records document the Office of the Chief Information Officer and Tufts Technology Services (TTS) more generally, including records of committees and external partnerships, strategic and project planning, presentations and documentation about TTS for Tufts faculty and staff, photographs of TTS outings and staff events, New England Association of Schools and Colleges accreditation documents, disaster planning, financial records, and information on hiring and personnel.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged in received order in one sub-series: David J. Kahle records.

did.unittitle: Administrative files and video footage of David Kahle

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This folder originally contained one file about TTS. Files that were not within a folder were bundled with this single item and video footage of David Kahle.

did.unittitle: Annual Report for Executive Vice President's Office

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Annual reports for the Executive Vice President's Office.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Documents related to Tufts Technology Services' design thinking and service design practices.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photos, videos, and other material related to former Tufts Chief Information Officer David J. Kahle's memorial.

did.unittitle: New England Association of Schools and Colleges accreditation

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tufts Technology Services reports and contributions to the NEASC Accreditation process, including documents related to the School of the Museum of Fine Arts and Tufts' NEASC 5 Year Interim Report.

did.unittitle: Office of the Chief Information Officer key presentations

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Meeting presentations and supporting documents for faculty, staff, trustees, and Tufts' executive leadership. Presentations cover information security audits, administration and finance, IT support, and town hall updates.

did.unittitle: Office of the Chief Information Officer meetings

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Presentations and related documents for meetings with various groups. These groups include: Administration & Planning Subcommittee, external partners and groups, CIO Council, Digital Humanities - Support Structures for Programs at Tufts, Enterprise Operations, Executive Vice President Staff Council, Faculty IT Liaison Program, IT Advisory Committee, IT Leaders Forum, Provost's Office, Support Services Steering Team, Trustees, Tufts Library Council, and University Risk and Compliance Committee.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Records of IT operations, including material related to the Federal Communications Commission, Tufts Service Desk Requests for Proposals, the School of the Museum of Fine Arts, and the Tufts network. Also includes records created by Compliance Process Partners, LLC, related to IT Service Management at Tufts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Presentations and reports about Tufts Technology Services for members of the senior leadership at Tufts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Documents related to video conferencing and collaboration tools, including WebEx and Box.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Meeting documents related to communications, program plans, IT resources, customer satisfaction metrics, strategic plans, IT organizational structure, organizational design and personnel, and executive committee meetings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Staff newsletters, memos, and presentations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Presentations and videos from monthly Tufts Technology Services Forums.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs from Tufts Technology Services social events, including holiday parties and summer outings.

did.unittitle: Tufts Technology Services service disruption reports

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reports about disruptions to TTS services.

did.unittitle: Tufts Distinction Awards - Tufts Technology Services submissions

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tufts Technology Services submissions to the Tufts Distinction Awards, which recognize the exceptional accomplishments of faculty and staff.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Records relating to Tufts Technology Services projects and strategic planning. Projects include Tufts Effectiveness in Administrative Management (TEAM) records, IT business continuity planning, research administration systems, Visual Understanding Environment 2.0 (VUE 2.0) records, Student Information System (SIS) records, TTS reorganization and strategic planning documents, and online course development records.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Meeting minutes, notes, and reports related to Tufts Technology Services projects and ongoing business, including physical space planning, academic technology, surveys, university information technology support, library technology, and strategic planning.

did.unittitle: Academic technology, disaster planning, and financial records

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Academic technology records, business continuity and disaster planning, and budget and audit records.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: CD-Rs, DVDs, 3.5" floppy disks, mini DV, and 120 MB Super Disks containing files related to Visual Understanding Environment (VUE), Best Practices: Introducing the Videopaper, disaster recovery planning, ArcGIS data, and other Tufts Technology Services projects.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Budget and strategic planning records, services statistics and metrics, student information system (SIS) records, and learning management system records.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Budget and strategic planning records; student information system (SIS) and PeopleSoft records; Academic, Administrative, and Information Technology Councils meeting notes and reports; Tufts Computing and Communications Services (TCCS) reports and planning documents; academic technology presentations and reports; and TTS project documentation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Academic technology reports, Tufts Effectiveness in Administrative Management (TEAM) records; research computing and data strategy reports, statistics, and correspondence; accreditation documents; University IT brochures, booklets, and reports; budget proposals; and TTS project documentation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: GIS systems, Tufts University Research Network (TuRN) Project, network infrastructure, and Visual Understanding Environment (VUE) records.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred by Library Technology Services, 2021 -- 2022, accessions UA-2022-010, UA-2022-021, and UA-2022-041.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged in received order.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This series was processed by Records and Accessioning Archivist, Jane Kelly, in October 2021 and April 2022. Received order was maintained. Digital materials were bagged using Bagger and ingested to Preservica. A file-level inventory was created, and series and collection-level description were updated at the time of processing.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records created by Library Technology Services (LTS). The bulk of the material consists of records from library teams, working groups, and committees that involved LTS staff. These groups relate to library automation, networking, metadata, and include the University Library Council, Digital Collections & Archives Advisory Committee, Library Systems Council, Web Advisory Group, and Services Steering Team. Records in this series also relate to capital campaigns, budgets, reorganization planning, and the Fedora repository implementation. There is also one box of audio-visual material, slides, and digital media.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Three VHS tapes, one labeled "Reduced 'Collaboration': A pair and four trios. 10 July 96"; thirteen mini DVs; one Premium 125P data cartridge; one box of slides with images of computer terminal and presentation about computers; seven Zip disks; and 21 CD-Rs and DVD-Rs. Contents of disks is unclear but may include course material or lecture recordings.
